etymology.description: Revolving around oneself; original character for 私 ‘selfish; private’; compare 公 ‘public’.
etymology.interpretation: Graph evokes an inward-turning motion, highlighting self-centered or private matters. It later gave rise to 私 and stands in conceptual opposition to 公 ‘public’.

examples.chinese: 此事属厶，不宜外传(此事屬厶，不宜外傳。)
examples.pinyin: Cǐ shì shǔ sī, bù yí wài chuán.
examples.english: This matter is private and should not be spread.

examples.chinese: 他为厶利而行，众人不齿(他為厶利而行，眾人不齒。)
examples.pinyin: Tā wèi sī lì ér xíng, zhòng rén bù chǐ.
examples.english: He acts for private gain and is despised by the people.

examples.chinese: 勿起厶心，以公为先(勿起厶心，以公為先。)
examples.pinyin: Wù qǐ sī xīn, yǐ gōng wéi xiān.
examples.english: Do not harbor selfish thoughts; put the public first.
